p: Enzyme feed additives having fibrolytic activities are used to enhancing fibre digestibility [ 162], feed conversion efficiency [ 163], and milk production [ 163– 165] of dairy cows. A reduction in the enteric CH 4 production was reported by Arriola et al. [ 163] where a fibrolytic enzyme additive was supplemented with a lactating cows’ diet (52% dietary forage). Conversely, some other studies revealed that exogenous fibrolytic enzyme additive increased CH 4 yield and altered rumen methanogen community composition, without affecting overall density of methanogens [ 166, 167]. Recently, Biswas et al. reported that dietary supplementation of lysozyme enzyme may improve rumen fermentation and reduce CH 4 emission in an in-vitro trial [ 168]. Therefore, more in-vivo study is needed before use of enzymes for methane mitigation strategy.
